p: To further determine the taxonomic placement of SINV-14 within the order Bunyavirales, Bayesian phylogenetic trees were inferred for representative ORFs from all four segments (Fig. 2). In accordance with identity analysis, SINV-14 RdRp was most closely related to that of FCTenV1 (Fig. 2A). These two viruses clustered closely to the tenui-like Horsefly horwuvirus (Wuhan horsefly virus, WhHV), the only species within the genus Horwuvirus (Fig. 2A). Moreover, SINV-14 glycoprotein and NS4 phylogenetic trees were congruent with RdRp, clustering closest to FCTenV1 and composing a sister clade with typical plant tenuiviruses (Fig. 2B and C). Interestingly, the phylogenetic tree of the nucleocapsid protein was incongruent compared to those of other viral proteins (Fig. 2D). It was more closely related to that of otter fecal bunyavirus and other representative viruses within family Phenuiviridae rather than plant tenuiviruses (Fig. 2D), in accordance with the identity analysis (Additional file 2: Table S2).
